abstract: After a year of tough negotiations, Amcor, the Australian packaging maker, has entered a binding offer to buy parts of Rio Tinto’s Alcan Packaging unit for slightly more than $2 billion.
snippet: After a year of tough negotiations, Amcor, the Australian packaging maker, has entered a binding offer to buy parts of Rio Tinto’s Alcan Packaging unit for slightly more than $2 billion.
lead_paragraph: After a year of tough negotiations, Amcor, the Australian packaging maker, has entered a binding offer to buy parts of Rio Tinto‘s Alcan Packaging unit for slightly more than $2 billion, the two companies announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Amcor Offers $2 Billion for Rio Tinto Packager
